description:
Reland 111519: Remove default plug-in on Mac, Gtk and Aura.

Aura doesn't do plug-ins, and Mac and Gtk already use in-renderer placeholders.

TBR=jam@chromium.org
BUG=62079
TEST=none

Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=111590

messages.text:
Please review.

The old version is patch set 0, for comparison.

On 2011/11/24 13:09:03, Bernhard Bauer wrote:
> Please review.
> 
> The old version is patch set 0, for comparison.

Patch set 1, I meant. Zero-based indexing ;-)

http://codereview.chromium.org/8689001/diff/2001/chrome/chrome_tests.gypi
File chrome/chrome_tests.gypi (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/8689001/diff/2001/chrome/chrome_tests.gypi#newcode844
chrome/chrome_tests.gypi:844: 'browser/default_plugin_uitest.cc',
not sure I understand this. You deleted the entry above, and you also put it on the exclusion list for aura?

Shouldn't you put it on the inclusion list for not-aura?

http://codereview.chromium.org/8689001/diff/2001/chrome/chrome_tests.gypi
File chrome/chrome_tests.gypi (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/8689001/diff/2001/chrome/chrome_tests.gypi#newcode844
chrome/chrome_tests.gypi:844: 'browser/default_plugin_uitest.cc',
On 2011/11/24 13:17:38, jochen wrote:
> not sure I understand this. You deleted the entry above, and you also put it on
> the exclusion list for aura?
> 
> Shouldn't you put it on the inclusion list for not-aura?

True, that seems like one too many ;-) I think the more common pattern is to list it under sources, then exclude it conditionally, so I'm going with that now.
